# Bringing a partner or family

Bringing a partner or family
Page Content

​You might want to bring your partner or family over to join you temporarily or permanently in Australia.

​You might want to bring your partner or family over to join you temporarily or permanently in Australia.

How you do this will depend on whether you are a visa holder or not, and if you are visa holder, which visa you have.

How you do this will depend on whether you are a visa holder or not, and if you are visa holder, which visa you have.

### Australian citizens or permanent residents inviting family

Australian citizens or permanent residents inviting family
1. Identify if it is going to be temporarily or permanently
Identify if it is going to be temporarily or permanently
2. Find the right visa based on their intention. Explore visa options forjoining your partner or family
Find the right visa based on their intention. Explore visa options for
joining your partner or family

### Visa holders inviting family

Visa holders inviting family
1. Identify if it is going to be temporarily or permanently
Identify if it is going to be temporarily or permanently
2. Check if your visa allowssubsequent entrantand that you have previously declared the members of your family. Seelist of all visas
Check if your visa allows
subsequent entrant
and that you have previously declared the members of your family. See
list of all visas
3. If your visa does not allow subsequent entrants, they will need to apply for a visa based on their intention. Explore visa options forjoining your partner or family
If your visa does not allow subsequent entrants, they will need to apply for a visa based on their intention. Explore visa options for
joining your partner or family

### Returning Australian bringing overseas-born family

Returning Australian bringing overseas-born family
1. For your children to get an Australian passport you will need to apply forAustralian citizenship by descenton their behalf. You can apply for an Australian passport on their behalf after their citizenship application is approved. Otherwise they will need a visa to come to Australia
For your children to get an Australian passport you will need to apply for
Australian citizenship by descent
on their behalf. You can apply for an Australian passport on their behalf after their citizenship application is approved. Otherwise they will need a visa to come to Australia
2. Your partner or other family, will need a visa
Your partner or other family, will need a visa
3. Find the right visa based on their intention. Explore visa options forjoining your partner or family
Find the right visa based on their intention. Explore visa options for
joining your partner or family
